website_summaries.verdict: The advantages it offers over less-costly models might not be worth the higher price tag.
pros: Features Power Curve system which greatly reduces clogging
cons: Lacks powered drive to the wheels

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since broom sticks
customer_reviews.text: It came fully assembled in the box. I absolutely enjoy using this thing as it is so much easier than shoveling snow. The only downside is that it works great for fresh powder but anything that's been compacted by feet, tires, or general buildup of ice is not very effective at removing and have to resort to using this like a regular shovel a few times since the motor doesn't seem powerful enough to remove it without potential long-term damage. It's still a great alternative to a more bulky snow remover.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Holman

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few weeks ago and just got the chance to use it for the first time today. I live in the Denver suburbs and we got 3-4” inches of snow. This machine simply couldn’t handle it at all. I tried to use it on my driveway and I had to stop every 15 seconds to clear the snow out of the blades. Basically you have to shovel the entire driveway beforehand and this machine clears off the last 1/4”. Very dissatisfied and disappointed. This machine is advertised up to depths of 12” but it can’t even handle 4” of fresh snow.
customer_reviews.author: C. N.

customer_reviews.title: Most disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This blower has so many design flaws. First that blue switch...bad idea on an electric product that can be easily disconnected from power. Second no way to secure the thick power cord you need for blower to run properly. Nothing is more frustrating than trying to keep the blower on with that stupid blue button and disconnecting cord. Third the shute control works the opposite of the way you turn it. How dumb! And for all that frustration it does a so-so job of cleaning snow. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Teena

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Arrived at my house the day of a big snow storm. I assembled it in about 2 minutes. Put the cord on it. About 40 minutes later my double driveway and sidewalks were clear. The snow overall was about 6 inches deep but the majority of the double driveway was 8-10 inches deep with super wet heavy snow. If you have been on the fence, jump off. This is the right blower for most homeowners.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine - if you know it's limitations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in January 2016, and it was useless. Virtually no snow. However in early 2018, this shovel proved its might. This is NOT a snowblower, and it's not very useful in more than six inches of snow. But for less than six inches of snow, it's just amazing. I had no problem clearing 5" of snow covering a two-car wide driveway in about fifteen minutes. Just as important - no messing around with gasoline. Plug it in, and go. And unlike snow blowers, the power shovel is light enough that I hang it from a large wall hook in the garage, so it doesn't take up any floor space. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: N. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Toro 18" 15 amp snowblower
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little snow blower. We just had 13 inches of wet snow that this little machine plowed right through in no time. It is light and easy to use. We used it on our deck and to clear dog and bird feeder paths through the lawn. My husband also used it for the driveway and walkways rather than bringing out our very large, heavy gas snow blower.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Keeps on trucking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this snow blower 3 years ago and it has lasted 3 season in the northeast winters and is still ticking. Sometimes it's hard to manage when the snowfall is quite heavy. I'd say that optimally you don't use this on more than 6 inches of snow because otherwise it's just too much work, not enough strength on this guy to take on more but I knew there would probably be a point at which this snow fairly priced electric snow blower was going to reach its capacity. If you need to deal with crazy amount of snow, go for bigger but this little guy has definitely saved me money on snow blowing services and energy using a shovel.
customer_reviews.author: GardenPixy

customer_reviews.title: Good for deck clearing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to handle the problem of snow build-up around the deck as the season goes on in snow country. By late February there is usually no place for more. This kicks it a little away if the wind isn't too high when it will all blow back in your face and onto the deck. 12' clear path is little light, I maybe should have considered the next size. Best not used on uneven ground given the plastic blades and skids vs wheels. I sometimes use it on small areas by lifting and walking along. Overall I'm happy enough with this in its limited use.
customer_reviews.author: Woods39

customer_reviews.title: Good for porches and walkways...............
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for clearing off my mom's porch, steps, walkways, and two-car parking space. It worked very well for the wood porch and steps, very well for the concrete walkways, but was totally inadequate for the black-top parking spaces that had iced over by the time I got to them. I ended up hiring someone who could do the entire snow removal for me, so I gave the snow thrower to a neighbor who has two porches and three walkways. You would have to evaluate your own needs and determine if this unit is what would fulfill your needs. I recommend it for wood porches and steps, even concrete pathways, but it is not meant to plow driveways.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great snowblower to have to clear right now paths and decks and other areas
customer_reviews.text: If you live where it snows and you have deck areas and walkway areas this unit is unbelievable I even used it in a blizzard and it actually cleared the snow. I also have a really big backyard and I was able to clear a path for my dog to be able to go out it's still working I've had it for a couple years great product well-made good value! I was able to get this on Amazon and delivered in a couple of days and I couldn't find it anywhere in the stores!!
customer_reviews.author: LisaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I ordered it, it was delivered, it's a ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it, it was delivered, it's a Power Shovel, once it snows I will try it our, what more could I ask for? Well I guess I could ask that the item last longer than five minutes. Seriously, first time to use in 3 inches of light snow and it broke within five minutes! I suppose it could have been a defective unit but I am not impressed at all with this shovel. Amazon was great though. This item was outside the return window but Amazon is refunding my money and shipping the item back for free. Amazon - 1/Tors - 0
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Works great with someone to manage the cord
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit in 2010. Grew frustrated trying to blow snow and manage the cords so hung it on the garage wall and went back to shoveling. As I got older my wife started helping shovel the snow. This afternoon it occurred to me that if both of us were going to be shoveling snow anyway why not give this another shot. With her managing the cord and me pushing the blower we did a much better job in less than half the time it would take to shovel with a lot less work.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: it does toss the snow pretty far and it's inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 snowblowers and an ATV plow; 2 Honda tracked, and one Toro gasoline paddle unit for cleaning down to the sidewalk surface. This electric Toro is a light duty unit. Used it twice to clear a 6'x40' second floor deck. Struggles with any amount of wet snow. The inability to direct the snow to the sides is a bit of a handicap. Not sure how long it's going to hold up. On the positive side, it does toss the snow pretty far and it's inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little gadget. Trying to keep up with mega snow storm this week in Oregon. First pass was about 8" and very heavy and wet which it handles OK with some physical effort. I then cleared after each 4-6" build up and it did it with ease, throwing snow a good 15-20 feet. Also very light so i was able to carry it down the path steps to work on them too. The only problem is the nozzle handle, which will slip and the nozzle gets stuck. You can still move it by hand so not a big deal. Overall a great product
customer_reviews.author: Martin D. Chorley

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my previous PowerCurve snow blower that lasted over 15 seasons before having enough problems to warrant its replacement. I was able to use it once before the weather warmed up...the snow was very wet and heavy and this little thing handled it without any problem. This one is also built sturdier than the old one I had...expecting it to last for a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: D. Shantz

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again if it broke! And in Mane we get lots of snow....
customer_reviews.text: A must if you have decks and porches to clean off...it's really amazing and easy to use, even for me here in Maine. We have deep snow and it works amazingly well. We've had to replace tiny screws on the handle after a year of service (kind of skimpy) but that's its....and we've had big storms. A true help when my husband was down after knee surgery, as I could use it.
customer_reviews.author: MaineIslandBlue

customer_reviews.title: One awesome winter tool investment!
customer_reviews.text: No regrets! You can really blow a lot of snow off of your deck or driveway. A worthy investment if you're living in parts where you get heavy snow. One word of caution - The handle extends out and is locked by a bolt. This has a tendency to fall off. I lost mine, but managed to get something from my parts bin to apply a permanent fix. But I would completely disregard this silly short coming because the advantages of this tool truly offsets all it's negatives.
customer_reviews.author: TimeTravellerTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction, broke after using a few times
customer_reviews.text: My expectations for this were low given the price I paid and the plastic blade, but I had still hoped to make it through a couple winters. Unfortunately it part that makes the blade spin stripped away quickly during one outing and it quickly became useless. I was already frustrated with the chute that wouldn't stay in place due to vibrations. I replaced with a similar Snow Joe that has been working much better and doesn't have the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy snow
customer_reviews.text: I gave this three stars because: 1: the plug isn’t compatible with 3 way heavy duty outdoor extension cords without cramming it in (not easy, but it will work)., and 2: it’s a little heavy. To be fair however, I didn’t use it on my deck (which is what I got it for) right away after it snowed, so a day of two later the snow had gotten hard, and understandably this will only work in light fluffy, fresh snow.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great Snow Blower If You Don't Need Gas-Powered Blower
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Toro electric snow blower that I've purchased. We made the mistake of purchasing a home with a long driveway and these snow blowers have been well worth their purchase cost. We don't get enough snow here to justify buying a big gas-powered snow blower and I wouldn't want the maintenance headaches of one either. The only issues with electric snow blowers is that they have a hard time handling snowfalls of 12-inches or more.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Looks ok but should have had better packaging.
customer_reviews.text: This item seemed to arrive in a toro box but oddly it had no packaging to keep it from getting bumped around in the box. It was just alone in the box with no packaging foam or plastic etc, other than the instruction manual tossed in with it. I have read the manual and plugged it in to make sure it’s working and the motor did start right up. I hope it’s ok. We haven’t had snow yet but probably will come January.
customer_reviews.author: Susan N.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely what I expected for $100
customer_reviews.text: The Toro Power Shovel does what I expected for the $100 I paid for it. I can easily just plug the shovel into any outdoor outlet and it's ready to go. The shovel is perfect for the sidewalk and easily blasts through the snow. Works best on pavement as it picks up rocks very easily. Only reason for the lack of a fifth star is there is no way to adjust where the snow is thrown and the distance it will be thrown. These settings are typical of a normal snow through. Now obviously this is a different product, but these adjustments would come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi C.

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Toro snowblower back in November and used it for the first time today. I am a 68 year old woman and I found it to be an amazing piece of equipment. We got ten inches of snow which I knew would be too deep for this snowblower. Well I was wrong, yes it did take a bit longer to clear the snow but it made my overwhelming task so much easier than shoveling. It really threw the snow 20 to 30 feet. Again I was amazed and delighted. This purchase was well worth the money and I couldn’t be happier unless it never snowed again.
customer_reviews.author: CARON

customer_reviews.title: Best $100 I've spent in some time
customer_reviews.text: For the size and the price of this model, it's a great item to have hanging next to the door when snow's coming. We just got hit here in NY with a ton of snow and I had this all ready to go. Opened up my door, the snow was up to my knees. Hit the button and within a few passes had a clear area. The snow was well over a foot (two feet in spots) and I found that by basically picking the unit up and dropping it in to the taller snow, this removed enough so the second pass was much more manageable. Best $100 I've spent in some time.
customer_reviews.author: Raildig

customer_reviews.title: It's not a snowblower
customer_reviews.text: I live in Michigan and we got a lot of snow this winter. I bought this to clear the deck for my new puppy. I got a late start so it was liking mowing your lawn after you waited too long. Once I got ahead of the snow this was a welcome too. The comments about it being one directional are valid. Straight line only. It overloads a little and struggles with packed snow. I would give it more stars if it had a directional discharge and a little less noise but it beats shoveling by a mile.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Inman

customer_reviews.title: Works well when it wants to.
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works okay, but I've had constant problems with the safety switch, and today it just stopped working. It's been used maybe a total of four hours since purchase, as it's just used on my decks. Now, I'm likely to have to get involved with taking stuff apart to see what's wrong with it. Don't need this on top of the aggravation of a November snow storm. Oh, and to get at the switch I need a security bit, which I don't have, so I ordered a set from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MiserableOldFart

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because I did not want to spend twice as much on a gas snowblower. However, I found it does not actually blow the snow very far after using it a few times. I have to be near the edge of the grass to get the snow there. It is also a pain to constantly mange the extension cord when using it. But that seems to be the trade off for a more cost effective snow blower. All in all I'm on the fence if I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: tunafish

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the toro 38361 shovel 7.5 amp electric snow thrower. I love this little snow thrower it may be little but it's powerful! It's light weight and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Tyann Iveys

customer_reviews.title: Just retired my standard snow shovel.
customer_reviews.text: This little guy really impressed me. I ordered it along with a cordless snow blower. Let's just say I got more use out of the Power Shovel. I was able to take care of my 350 sq ft patio j+ 250 sq ft deck in less than 20 mins. Its a bit of a work out. You have to keep in mind its about 12lbs at the end of a pole so, it can get heavy quick if you have to move and reposition a lot. Still better than any standard shovel and for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Intended for fresh dry snow
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked well for 1 Montana winter for our light dry snow. I would be sure to remove the snow the same day before it reached 6 inches. The second winter I was gone for 1 week and came back to 5 inches of snow including a 2 inch windblown crust but not icy. The machine was very slow to move this snow and the motor failed before finishing the 240 square feet driveway. I assumed the blower would react poorly if the snow could could not be removed promptly but I needed a very light machine. A trade-off that failed for me.
customer_reviews.author: Apothesine

customer_reviews.title: Toro 18-inch electric snow blower - Best you can get!
customer_reviews.text: Toro 18-inch electric snow blower. Bought this one early. No snow yet. Seems to work well in a quick test. Be careful - don't throw out the box - because for some reason, they leave a plastic handle, a screw, and a washer, all loose in the bottom of the box. Should have been securely attached. Still a great product, at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: DishwasherSafe

customer_reviews.title: Too fragile.
customer_reviews.text: Ok... just too darn fragile. Clearing a few inches of snow and everything is fine.... until I hit a ball of ice. Bam. Belt strips in a heart beat. Unit is no good and repair cost, unless I want to do it myself, is about what it costs to buy a new unit. It's not even good for a light snow cover because you have to tilt it down to get to the snow which causes the blade to scrape and wear down. I won't buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Steplander

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This little snow thrower punches way beyond it's weight. I live in Maine and wanted this to clear my deck. It works perfectly and does a great job. I recently used it on a 12" snowfall. I went slowly and it cleared the snow. Just amazing!
customer_reviews.author: RJ in Maine

customer_reviews.title: It took just seconds to get it ready and it works GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: YES, no more back breaking shoveling. I order this at the last minute and it arrived hours before the largest snow fall we've had in a few years. It took just seconds to get it ready and it works GREAT!!! I was able to clear my driveway in 30 minutes when before it would take hours. That's a driveway that is a little of 2-car lengths wide and 4-car lengths long I like the fact that it runs off electricity and not gas and it cleared my driveway all the way down to the surface - after 15" of snow fell overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Letitia B.

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok for small to medium soft snow. Wet snow is hard
customer_reviews.text: Pro: electronic, no maintenance, didn’t take up much storage space, no smelly toxic burning gas. Con: not enough power to throw wet snow. Too light to dig into the wet snow, need to apply downward force by hand, it gets tiring very easy holding the power control bar
customer_reviews.author: YUYU LI

customer_reviews.title: Between constantly fighting the safety switch and a 12 gauge 50 foot cable that is like a metal rod when cold
customer_reviews.text: The most suborn and difficult machine I have ever used. Between constantly fighting the safety switch and a 12 gauge 50 foot cable that is like a metal rod when cold, I will never buy another corded machine again.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: This model is no longer good
customer_reviews.text: I have bought total 3 of this model snow blower from amazon. The first (2002) was very good, lasting 9 years; the 2nd (2011), for 6 years, but the last one (2016), only for 2 years. All are motor dead problems. In last two years I have added a Honda gas snow blower. The electric one only did small job. I just felt the quality of this model is no longer good. This time I bought a Snow Joe for the side job.
customer_reviews.author: Hua

customer_reviews.title: Durable workhorse
customer_reviews.text: After several winters, this item works and looks as good as new. I have a city-sized lot with the garage located at the back of the property, so the driveway runs nearly the entire depth of the property. Clearing the driveway and walks usually takes less than 30 minutes. Neighbors on either side have large, gas-powered snow blowers, so I've been able to compare results. The smaller, lighter, and quieter Toro does just as good a job as the 'big boys,' without the hassles of dealing with a gasoline engine. No gas or oil to buy, no difficulties getting the engine started, no fumes.
customer_reviews.author: R.J.B.

customer_reviews.title: my back saver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little snow blower in Nov 2010 and still works great. Hope the wheels are little bigger but other than that I'm happy with the product. FYI, I live in the northern part of new jersey...
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Product awful damage to my sidewalk and walkway- will cost thousands to repair
customer_reviews.text: What a bad situation this has caused. I purchased it post open heart surgery because I could not push or start my regular snow remover. So bought this with special cords. Has damaged my sidewalk and my walkway- actually cause breaking of the concrete alt every area on the outsides of where I pushed it. Just terrible. Will cost me thousands to have concrete repaired. Cracks concrete everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Deborah May

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This little snow blower is a workhorse. We used it during the recent blizzard and though we had to knock down the 2 foot drifts before using the blower, it definitely saved us from the heavy lifting. Also used it for a 5 inch snow event and it was great. I recommend this if you don't have a massive amount of space for storage of a larger gas powered blower and don't have a large space to clear. Worked fine for our large driveway and sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: milesgram

customer_reviews.title: the good. I was able to clean up about 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: First, the good. I was able to clean up about 4 inches if wet snow. It didn't bog and it does have a fairly long throw. The bad. You can adjust the hight of the handle to suit your needs. The only problem is that the clamp isn't strong enough to keep the handle from sliding down. Some swearing followed several attempts to adjust the handle length. This was a review based on a single usage.
customer_reviews.author: Zorecati

customer_reviews.title: All around, great
customer_reviews.text: Hi, This is the small version. There are larger ones, but lacking upper body strength I am glad that I got this. This really does throw the snow, wet or powdery. Stay away from ice and other hard objects. Watch the wind! I have used this on one foot of snow. I either took 2 swipes (2x 5" layers) or small strips through the full depth. It does take a little to get accustomed to the straight direction - but found that to not be a problem. I can't speak to the long term durability as it is new this winter, but I wouldn't have made it through the 100+ inches of snow we got in 5 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Alternative to Gas-Powered Snow Blowers
customer_reviews.text: This did a good job if the snow was 6" deep or less, otherwise you must lift it to shovel snow. This does not have a chute to change the direction of the snow; it's a shovel. That being said, it is an improvement over a normal shovel because there is less lifting. Buy an electric cord rated for outdoor use in the cold. No gas or oil needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Changed my snow shoveling life!
customer_reviews.text: Cleared 8" of wet snow from my very-shaded 3-car driveway...and sidewalk on the left...and sidewalk on the right...and around the corner. All in under an hour. Adjustable handle so I can stand straight. Powerful - Threw that snow out into the street. The guy at the lawn mower store tried to tell me "wet and electricity don't go together" and of course, they don't if you don't take care of your cord. Invest in a good-quality, construction grade cord and inspect it regularly for nicks and tears. That kind of cord is made to be used in spaces that are exposed to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: rhinestonelife

customer_reviews.title: it was a struggle
customer_reviews.text: The power shovel is very heavy and difficult to maneuver. I was just trying to clear away the snow that my plowing contractor couldn't remove in areas in front of the garage doors and around my car. Anything more than 2"of snow was very difficult to tackle. I'm am a woman in my mid 60's, so maybe it would be more satisfactory for a younger and stronger individual. I finally gave up and used my regular shovel. I will try to give it another chance. Maybe I was just expecting too much...
customer_reviews.author: 60 something

customer_reviews.title: Whoa!
customer_reviews.text: In love with this item. Just had a blizzard here in CT. We received a total of 18inches. If you even think his could tackle 18inches in one shot you would be mistaken. It took me 3 times outside during the day long storm to keep up with the snow. It's a power shovel- treat it as such. It's not a mini snowblower. Use it as you would a shovel that you don't have to pick up. I find that when I use it like a vacuum I do much better. Smooth strokes back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Roy

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but somewhat awkward to use.
customer_reviews.text: While 13 lbs doesn’t sound like much it was harder to use than expected. It would not slide easily even on smooth surfaces which required that it be held off the surface to be used. Having said all that it throws the snow very well and did it in less time than required by hand. It would have been better if the snow could be thrown to the side rather than straight ahead where you might have to throw it again to clear it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P

customer_reviews.title: Makes clearing pathways easier
customer_reviews.text: Great for clearing pathways and small driveways. We have a large driveway and this supplements the snowblower for the hard to reach areas. It does well in 3-5 inches of snow. The blade is made out of hard plastic but appears durable enough to handle ice and hard snow to a certain extent. Everything looks like it can be replaced easily should something happen. Overall happy with the purchase and quality of the brand.
customer_reviews.author: K wood

customer_reviews.title: but battery ones don't do as good a job
customer_reviews.text: This thing has power and can throw snow. I think I need to adjust the handle so my back doesn't hurt. The cord is a bit of a hassle , but battery ones don't do as good a job. I am female and 63 and for my two car drive and front walks it works fine. (4 inches of snow.)
customer_reviews.author: SueLT

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use right out of the box. No set up or assembly required. Have used on walks steps and my backyard decking. Got a light snow with a freezing rain over it a week ago. Tried using a snow shovel to clear an area of my deck and it just bounced around. Plugged in the Power Shovel and gave it a shot. Cut through the crusted snow like butter. Did a great job. Only down side is I wish it were wider, so I didn't have to make so many passes. But even at that, still much faster and easier than a snow shovel. I would recommend this to anyone looking to clear walks decks or small areas....
customer_reviews.author: Johnny50g

customer_reviews.title: Used this in powdery and wet snow. Small, ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this in powdery and wet snow. Small, yet powerful enough for sidewalks and small two car driveways (ie. town homes). The extension cord would sometimes disconnect if you get hung up or step on it while in use (which is common with ALL electrical power shovel) so you can lightly wrap it with electrical tape at the connection before use. Yes...such a task might turn off millennial home owners..but not a major inconvenience. I chose the electrical version since I don't have to worry about storing combustibles especially with toddlers around
customer_reviews.author: cpac

customer_reviews.title: works great if you are short and only moving light snow
customer_reviews.text: Handle is too short. If you are 5'5 or under it is probably perfect. Otherwise ends up hurting the back. Only really works well on light fluffy snow, it is wet or icy forget it. We tried primarily on a deck, more of a pain than it was worth. Also a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: James Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: So much for buying the best. It's a real downer not being able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I could have bought a different brand for less money. A lot less. I wish I had. There was not enough hardware thrown loose in the box to attach the handle. Home Depot had the necessary parts. So much for buying the best. It's a real downer not being able to assemble and use a new in box product.
customer_reviews.author: rick o shea

customer_reviews.title: Great for small areas.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small house and a small walk. This did a great job clearing about 8 to 10 inches of snow. I only gave it four stars because it is pretty heavy and I wish I could have directed the snow in other directions than straight ahead. That being said, there is much to praise! First, the snow thrower is really quiet. Secondly, it is much easier than shoveling everything manually and it is much faster too. Last of all, it was small enough to clear my eight steps which are about three feet by two feet wide. With the snowline arch, it cleared them wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: cleans snows very fast, I have these issues 1- ...
customer_reviews.text: cleans snows very fast, I have these issues 1- To turn it, you have to always keep two buttons down at the same time all the time which is very borning. Keeping the small one down always makes you crazy, I used wrapping taps to keep it down all the time no matter if I am used it or not. 2- the blades is made of non solid plastics, mine broke once it hit the stones which will likely happen to anyone at certain point
customer_reviews.author: Choobbari

customer_reviews.title: It would also be better if it had a directional shoot so that you ...
customer_reviews.text: This blower works well, however if you use the right Gage extension cord it is heavy and in real cold weather it becomes stiff and hard to manage. It would also be better if it had a directional shoot so that you could aim better where the snow goes. With,the slightest breeze or wind, the snow ends up sometimes where you had just cleaned. It does have power and does shoot the snow a good 20 feet or more.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!!! Tons of snow and worked great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm over sixty with very bad bones...no strength in my arms and a cast on my foot...Was afraid of the snow this year because I can't shovel...can't lift. A friend told me to try this Toro Power Shovel..Sold lots at the Hardware store so I bought it..and I just used it...I Can't Say Enough About it!!! It was incredible...fast...quiet...and so easy to use...Shoots the snow awesome and the metal roof slid on to the deck and that packed snow was no problem for this little light weight totally awesome snow thrower...Great Buy!!!! Snowed over 8 inches last night...deep heavy snow.....very wet...Wasn't expecting it to work on such heavy snow. No problem...!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Happy

customer_reviews.title: The Toro is amazing, and for anyone who is a heart patient ...
customer_reviews.text: The Toro is amazing, and for anyone who is a heart patient like me it is a Godsend. I was able to clear my elevated deck, and front stairs and porch very easily and without the strain of shoveling. My cardiologist asked about the snow situation, and when I told him about it, he looked it up on his ipad, then said he wished more patients used these. Cheaper than a heart attack, and actually a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: older woman (63 yrs old at 5'6" and only 100#) so I thought a light weight machine would be a good idea. I should have gotten something a little ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough, but I didn't consider the weight when I bought it (only 25#) and it does 'bounce' a little. I'm a small, older woman (63 yrs old at 5'6" and only 100#) so I thought a light weight machine would be a good idea. I should have gotten something a little bit heavier. But this one works just fine. I'd recommend for light jobs.
customer_reviews.author: bvogler

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed handle
customer_reviews.text: Product works well and throws the snow a good distance. However upon my third use of the product there is one tiny screw that holds the handle on. This screw fell out and because the handle is adjustable and the screw only has about 3 threads to hold the screw in when the screw came out it stripped the threads making it impossible to get a new screw in to hold the handle on the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R Millette

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in moderate snows.
customer_reviews.text: Got this a couple of years ago, and for what it is, it works very well. It's light, and will go through even 6" or so of heavy wet snow pretty well. It's limited by having to plug it in, and it's not what you'd want for a long driveway somewhere that gets snow measured in feet, but that should be obvious. Well worth the money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple years ago and I have to say that I resisted buying one of these too long. I worried it would be excessively fragile and not all that effective, but after the blizzard the other year I knew I had to do something. Not only has it held up to a couple season's use, but it is quite effective even with deep snow if you use it right. We have stairs down the bank to the street to clear, and a full-sized snow blower would have been dangerous and ineffective with those, but this handles the situation just fine. Only negative is that it throws straight ahead so clearing in angled strips is the most effective.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burch

customer_reviews.title: Without a garage to keep a huge snow blower, this Toro Power Shovel is the perfect answer.
customer_reviews.text: Since I bought this shovel, we haven't had a major snowstorm where I live. However, for three inches of snow, this shovel takes care of it on my sidewalk and around my cars perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Oberman

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This little blower works extremely well. I had 4 foot of snow covering the deck at my cabin and I was able to to blow the top half of it off before hitting an ice layer. So I only had to shovel 1/2 the snow off. I've used this thing so much in the last month that if it died tomorrow it wouldn't owe me a thing. Easily one of the best products I've ever bought off of amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn H.

customer_reviews.title: Better off using a shovel not worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: It's more work than necessary to operate to remove snow . Constant shoving & pushing to work doesn't work at ease on real snowy days not worth pushing to pick up light snow for the price . Too much work to use just like an ordinary shovel after plugging in this electric device.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: This machine is fine for light
customer_reviews.text: This machine is fine for light, fluffy snow, but difficult to use on heavy wet snow. With heavy,wet snow the chute jams continually. The path it cuts is also very narrow. Otherwise it is well built and light enough to carry up onto the porch when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Schoonmaker

customer_reviews.title: Great snow blower for up to 8 inch depth
customer_reviews.text: I live in south-western Virginia where we get near no snow or can get 6-8 inches at a time. This electric is a high ampere unit that has lots of power and long throw. It handles 6 and 8 inch snow very well. I have not tested at 10 inch depth. Not wanting to get into gas driven snow blowers that are too big and overpower my need, I found this Toro a perfect fit. It has run for 3 years now and has not missed a beat. It throws dry snow very well and wet snow maybe 6 feet. It is impressive and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: L. D. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: but I'd recommend a de-icer after clearing with the snow blower
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. Cleared 6 inches of packed snow from half of drive way (previously shoveled the other half which is why I bought this). It also managed to scrape some ice, but I'd recommend a de-icer after clearing with the snow blower. Very light weight and easy to maneuver. Be sure to get a heavy duty outdoor extension that's long enough. Two cords joined will probably trip your GFI. Snow will get in between the joined cords and melt.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised just how much snow it would move and how far it threw it! I've had back surgery and can't shovel anymore but can clear my 125 foot drive in 35 minutes! The biggest hassle is the cord but you get used to that. It does get plugged in very heavy "end of the driveway" snow that has sand and salt in it - but very easy to clear the clogged snow (just remember to unplug!) Wish I had known about it years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Bette O.

customer_reviews.title: This one has bigger wheels which I love. Wish it had LED lights like some of ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my older Toro power curve. This one has bigger wheels which I love. Wish it had LED lights like some of the cordless snow throwers do. It doesnt seem to throw snow as far as my older powercurve 1800 does but it gets the job done. It throws snow through the front a little which I know is not what it should do, but it gets the job done and saves my back so I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: AJ 88

customer_reviews.title: Little Toro Power Shovel Taking On Another Big Mn Snow Storm
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how fast this little machine cuts through our recent 8" of snow. Just plug the Toro Power Shovel in, push the button, pull the lever and away it goes! The cord is a hassle, but shoveling all these February (2019) Minnesota record breaking snow falls we've had, we will deal with the cord. Thank you, Toro!
customer_reviews.author: Journey Forward

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Light duty, but capable of handling deep snow in passes. WAY better than shoveling! Fair price=great value. Love mine so I bought one for my parents. Much easier to store in a condo than a full blown walk behind snowblower.
customer_reviews.author: Yan880

customer_reviews.title: No more shoveling
customer_reviews.text: Took away all my front of the house snow! Only setback is having to hold button in and squeeze trigger to make it work! Button does not lock in place
customer_reviews.author: bertrand e cabana

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, but poor execution. This snow power shovel only blows the snow forward and at a ridiculously strong and far distance. Unless you hate your neighbors and want to throw all the snow over to their yard, i wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robby B

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived and I tried to put the handle on but the electrical cord was too short. I called Toro and they didn’t have the serial number on file. Opened a case with Toro, returnEd snowblower to a local store and now I have to wait some more without a snowblower to get this mess straightened out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: snow shovel
customer_reviews.text: bought it about 7 years ago. still doing its job
customer_reviews.author: johnboy

customer_reviews.title: This little unit easily throws snow 20 feet and more -- even fairly ...
customer_reviews.text: The verdict: I'm genuinely impressed. This little unit easily throws snow 20 feet and more -- even fairly wet stuff. Cuts through crusty iced-over crud, no problem, and can handle 10 to 12-inch fall without really forcing. It even did the path over the lumpy lawn out to the generator without hanging. Highly directable, both very high elevation and across around 160 degrees horizontally. And it never jams. Toro did a fine job engineering this sturdy, capable little machine. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: etLux

customer_reviews.title: Machine will  last two years maximum.  Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Machine stopped working in less than two years. Toro replaced it. Now, two years later, it stopped working. I live in Denver, Colorado, not Buffalo, New York, or Minnesota.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Lake

customer_reviews.title: defective switch
customer_reviews.text: I've had the shovel since 01/12/2012 and used it a half dozen times and the trigger switch went bad.Contacted a certified Toro dealer to repair and was told they can't get the part.Call Toro up and was told that the Power Shovel was junk as the switch was not available. You would think they would care more for their customer Why build a n item costing a hundred dollars and a 50 cent part goes out and the whole unit is junk.I will never buy another Toro Product again if this is the way they treat their customers
customer_reviews.author: msdank1

customer_reviews.title: Do not really ecommend!
customer_reviews.text: It has much less power than our older electric TORO, which is same size and same model. Throws snow a significant distance shorter. It is now our emergency backup. Also inconvenient on/off switch. We found a used old unit that works well, the new unit stays up on the wall for decoration.
customer_reviews.author: zenon n.

customer_reviews.title: Just Love it it's FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it in 2015 and never got a chance to use it . Here we go again here in New England 2016 January first storm and first use . Just Love it it's FANTASTIC . Light weight ,easy to use ,lots of power . People say it's no good if snow is over six inches , that's not true ,it's a WORK HORSE as long as the snow isn't frozen . Can't wait for the next Storm . TORO ,TORO ,TORO !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Leary

customer_reviews.title: This was the best piece of home equipment I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: This was the best piece of home equipment I've purchased. I'm all things girl and while I could easily spend a grip on jewelry, makeup, purses, etc., I've never felt that way about home tools. This has changed my mind. Winter 2014-15 it was adequate for the snowfall we had. It's not meant for 18 inch accumulation, but it is helping and convincened me to get the next size Toro snowblower. Love it and will get the snow off my deck this afternoon with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Williams

customer_reviews.title: The most economical snow blower out there (short of shoveling)
customer_reviews.text: A great snow blower that has worked with a little snow, 12" of snow, and slush. Takes me 15 minutes to plow everything (the driveway, walkway, and curb for mail delivery)! Cost is around 30 cents worth of electricity! No oil/gas cost, smell, loud noise, or maintenance! The biggest downside is the stupid forearm workout they try to give you with the dumb button your supposed to hold down. I felt the need to zip tie it to the on position permanently. Just plug in to turn on, unplug to turn off. I recommend amazon's 12ga 100ft cord that stays completely flexible in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: CMA

customer_reviews.title: A bit on the heavy side
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes that my girlfriend could shovel her snow, so her aging grandfather wouldn't have to. But its too heavy for her. If you need to clear a small area and only need to throw snow forward, this is might work for you. When I use it, I like the fact that I don't have to scoop and lift any snow, sparing my back any aches. I accidentally hit stone steps with the rotating blade and the sound was loud, but luckily nothing broke.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: Great deck cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Throws snow about 20 feet ahead. Works great on my deck. The only drawback is that snow flies in your face. For the jerk who wrote DUH about the snow flying back in your face - it isn't because I'm going towards the wind, it's because there isn't a big enough lip on the top to help the snow shoot out a lot of the snow dust flies back at you. We have just had snow storm, after snow storm in Michigan. We had over a foot of snow on our deck (some of it pretty heavy because we let it accumulate) and this little machine worked like a champion blowing it away. We love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: VAMMICHIGAN

customer_reviews.title: I have been using it for three winters and this ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for three winters and this is an amazingly powerful snow blower for an electrical model with a plastic blade. It even throws slushy or packed snow far away. The wheels are really flimsy and it's light so you have to really push it onto the snow to be able to grab it and get it to work. This is for you if you have a short (2-3 car lengths) and narrow driveway, otherwise you should get a gas powered one.
customer_reviews.author: C.G.

customer_reviews.title: Even more lightweight than expected...
customer_reviews.text: ...which is exactly what I was looking for. Because it's so lightweight, it is easy to jockey it up and down for high areas. It is tiresome to hold down the power bar, but I had read about that in the review and was prepared. I use a long velcro tie that I can wrap around bar, and just push it to the side to turn it off. Worked great. Toro plows right down to driveway/sidewalk. and the directional bar is with it's wide loop is very easy to access and use. You will need a cord protector box to keep cords together: I used the Stanley 39387 EZ Outdoor Power Cord Box.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Gould

customer_reviews.title: better job of clearing our driveway
customer_reviews.text: Our driveway extends 30 ft back from the street, but it rises 15 ft higher than the street. This is a challenge to clear the winter snow. Our neighbor's gas powered 3 ft wide blower does a faster, better job of clearing our driveway, but, given the crap you have to go thru to keep a gas powered snow blower going, I vote for the Toro, as long as the snow is less that 12" deep.
customer_reviews.author: unhappy buyer

customer_reviews.title: nice, light, nimble, effective
customer_reviews.text: Gave this one to mother-in-law for Christmas while the wife got the Snow Joe 10.5A. They both work well and are similar priced. This one is a bit lighter and easier to handle for the senior citizen.Throws snow quite a ways, which may not be good for close quarters, condos, townhouses etc. Be sure to aim it toward the yard or neutral territory and not bury your neighbor's car while clearing out your own driveway. Must take wind into consideration as to not get completely covered with snow while operating.
customer_reviews.author: desertfox

customer_reviews.title: and if your not careful I can see it stripping quite easily. the unit does have good power for clearing ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the porch steps at my house, as its small and light, BUT, there is no way to direct the snow. it always goes straight, and if the wind is against you, you will get a face full, also the habdle has a way of coming loose, and if your not careful I can see it stripping quite easily. the unit does have good power for clearing snow, but I like to direct the snow. I give it three stars, just for those two reasons.
customer_reviews.author: gcm

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product a lot. The year I purchased this in NYC we got hit a really bad winter. This snowblower helped save me from extended back pain. Keep in mind a gas blower is more powerful but you never have to do maintenance to this. If you are about low maintenance and you have patience using this it'll work well. Since it's electric you have to make sure you go out before the snow piles up too high. It does get annoying holding the trigger down while pushing it around and dragging a cord. Positive side is you never have to change the oil in this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Denver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs.
customer_reviews.text: Superb machine. Easy to maintain. Not for deep snow, but I use it when the snow reaches 2”-3” and then repeat. Rarely clogs.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Passed a pretty severe test right off.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this recently to clear my decks but wasn't sure if it would handle heavy wet snow. So last week, we had two days of heavy wet snow and I cleared 10" of it off the decks twice. I wouldn't want to ask a lot more but it handled that well. It's also light, easy to carry around when needed, and easy to use. So far, really good!
customer_reviews.author: Spiker

customer_reviews.title: it works great now after being adjusted
customer_reviews.text: My machine (electric) had a problem starting, with the warranty i had on it, it works great now after being adjusted. I love this thing, it is perfect size for me and it takes on alot more snow then i thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: frieda rosell

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bought 9/2015, stopped working at the first run at 12/2017,
customer_reviews.author: Boris Livshits

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my grandma who is 74 years old still shoveling her own drive way. She seems to like it, light weight enough she can carry it, and still throws the snow good while not causing her problems.
customer_reviews.author: Karyl Edwards

customer_reviews.title: and easy to maneuver around my back deck
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my needs -- typical winters here have 3-4 snow storms each month, each less than 5inches or less of snow. It's also very light, and easy to maneuver around my back deck. Has a little trouble with slushy snow, but works great for moving a few inches of powder. My only complaint is the power control bar -- it's very easy to loosen my grip slightly, resulting in the safety interlock turning the motor off.
customer_reviews.author: stephen christensen

customer_reviews.title: Not too loud and doesn’t vibrate
customer_reviews.text: Does a nice job, easy to adjust and use. Shoots snow about 8 feet or so.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfden

customer_reviews.title: Handle cheap design
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable handle is a design flaw. One little screw holds it in place. After using it a couple times the small screw vibrated loose and disappeared in the snow, rendering the shovel useless.
customer_reviews.author: diane a.

product_meta.title: Toro 38381 18-Inch 15 Amp Electric 1800 Power Curve Snow Blower,Black
product_meta.description: Size:18-Inch 15 Amp Power CurveToro 38381 18-Inch 15 Amp Electric 1800 Power Curve Snow Blower
feature_bullets: Number 1 Brand of electric snow thrower in the United States
Moves up to 700-Pounds of snow per minute for efficient snow clearing
15 Amp electric snow blower for walkways, patios, decks, small driveways, and other residential areas
18-Inch clearance width and 12-Inch intake height for quick clearing
Power Curve technology cleans down to the pavement and helps prevent clogging; 160-degree adjustable chute for optimal snow-blowing control
Full-bail ergonomic handle, lift handle, quick level, zip deflector, lightweight design, and easy assembly

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,486 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
